shortBio: Massimo Bottura is an Italian restaurateur and chef. He is the owner of Osteria Francescana, a three-Michelin-star restaurant in Modena, Italy. Bottura has been listed among Time magazine's Most Influential People in the World and has received numerous awards for his culinary achievements.

recipes.name: Parmigiano-Reggiano Wheel
recipes.cookingMethod: Mix the Parmigiano-Reggiano, Gorgonzola, taleggio, ricotta and heavy cream in a large bowl. Spoon the mixture into a 9-inch round cake pan lined with plastic wrap. Refrigerate for at least 3 hours, or until set. Unmold onto a platter and let stand at room temperature for 1 hour before serving.

recipes.name: Risotto alla Parmigiana
recipes.cookingMethod: In a medium saucepan, bring the chicken broth to a simmer over medium heat. In a large pot or Dutch oven, heat the olive oil over medium heat. Add the onion and sauté until translucent, about 5 minutes. 4. Add the rice and stir to coat with the oil. Add 1 cup of the simmering broth and stir until the broth is absorbed. Continue adding the broth, 1 cup at a time, stirring constantly and allowing each addition to be absorbed before adding the next, until the rice is al dente, about 20 minutes. Stir in the Parmesan cheese and serve immediately.

recipes.name: Tagliatelle al Ragù di Maiale
ingredients: Salt and freshly ground black pepper
recipes.cookingMethod: Cook the pasta in a large pot of salted boiling water until al dente. Meanwhile, in a large skillet, heat the olive oil over medium heat. Add the onion, carrot and celery and sauté until the vegetables are soft, about 10 minutes. Add the ground pork and cook until browned, about 10 minutes. Add the wine and cook until evaporated, about 5 minutes. Add the crushed tomatoes, bay leaves, salt and pepper and bring to a simmer. Reduce the heat to low and simmer for 1 hour. Serve the ragù over the cooked pasta.

shortBio: Giada De Laurentiis is an Italian-American chef, writer, and television personality. She is the host of Food Network's Giada at Home and has authored several cookbooks. De Laurentiis has received numerous awards for her culinary achievements and has been featured on several television programs and in various publications.

recipes.name: Lemon Spaghetti
ingredients: Salt and freshly ground black pepper
recipes.cookingMethod: Cook the spaghetti in a large pot of boiling salted water until tender but still firm to the bite, stirring occasionally, about 8 minutes. Meanwhile, whisk the oil, Parmesan, and lemon juice in a large bowl to blend. Drain the spaghetti, reserving 1 cup of the cooking liquid. Toss the spaghetti with the lemon sauce, and the reserved cooking liquid, adding 1/4 cup at a time as needed to moisten. Season with salt and pepper to taste.

recipes.name: Italian Wedding Soup
recipes.cookingMethod: Mix the beef, bread crumbs, Parmesan, eggs, and parsley in a bowl. Roll into small meatballs. Bring the broth to a boil in a large pot. Add the meatballs and the pasta and simmer for 8-10 minutes until the pasta is tender and the meatballs are cooked through. Stir in the spinach and cook for another 1-2 minutes until wilted. Season with salt and pepper to taste.

recipes.name: Caprese Salad
ingredients: Salt and freshly ground black pepper
recipes.cookingMethod: Slice the tomatoes and the mozzarella cheese into 1/4-inch thick slices. Layer the tomato, mozzarella, and basil leaves on a large platter. Drizzle with the olive oil and season with salt and pepper to taste.

shortBio: Fabio Viviani is an Italian-American chef, restaurateur, and television personality. He is the owner of several restaurants in the United States and has appeared on several television programs, including Top Chef. Viviani has authored several cookbooks and has received numerous awards for his culinary achievements.

recipes.name: Braised Chicken Thighs
recipes.cookingMethod: Preheat oven to 375°F. Season chicken thighs with salt and pepper. Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add chicken and cook until browned, about 5 minutes per side. Transfer to a baking dish. Add onion, carrots, and celery to the same skillet and cook until softened, about 5 minutes. Add chicken stock and bay leaf and bring to a boil. Pour over chicken. Cover with foil and bake until chicken is cooked through, about 45 minutes. Remove foil and broil until skin is crispy, about 5 minutes.

recipes.name: Spaghetti Carbonara
recipes.cookingMethod: Cook spaghetti according to package instructions. Reserve 1 cup of pasta water and drain spaghetti. In a large skillet, cook pancetta over medium-high heat until crispy, about 8 minutes. Add garlic and cook until fragrant, about 1 minute. In a bowl, whisk together eggs, Parmesan cheese, Pecorino Romano cheese, salt, and pepper. Add cooked spaghetti to the skillet with pancetta and garlic. Toss to combine. Remove from heat and pour egg mixture over spaghetti. Toss quickly to combine, adding reserved pasta water as needed to create a creamy sauce. Serve immediately.

recipes.name: Grilled Ribeye Steak
recipes.cookingMethod: Preheat grill to high heat. Season ribeye steaks with olive oil, garlic, oregano, thyme, salt, and pepper. Grill steaks for 4-5 minutes per side for medium-rare, or until desired doneness.  In a bowl, whisk together eggs, Parmesan cheese, Pecorino Romano cheese, salt, and pepper. Add cooked spaghetti to the skillet with pancetta and garlic. Toss to combine. Remove from heat and pour egg mixture over spaghetti. Toss quickly to combine, adding reserved pasta water as needed to create a creamy sauce. Serve immediately.

shortBio: Gino D’Acampo is an Italian chef and television personality. He is the host of Gino's Italian Escape and has authored several cookbooks. D’Acampo has received numerous awards for his culinary achievements and has appeared on several television programs, including This Morning and Celebrity Juice.

recipes.name: Spaghetti alle vongole
ingredients: small bunch of flat-leaf parsley, roughly chopped
recipes.cookingMethod: Cook the spaghetti in a large pan of salted boiling water until al dente. Meanwhile, rinse the clams in a colander under cold running water. Heat the olive oil in a large frying pan over a medium heat and fry the garlic and chilli for 1 minute. Add the clams and white wine, then cover and cook for 5 minutes or until the clams have opened. Discard any that remain closed. Drain the spaghetti and toss with the clams and their juices. Sprinkle with parsley and serve immediately.

recipes.name: Risotto ai funghi
ingredients: 1 litre hot chicken or vegetable stock
25g dried porcini mushrooms, soaked in 100ml hot water for 10 minutes and drained
salt and freshly ground black pepper
recipes.cookingMethod: Melt half the butter in a large saucepan and fry the onion and garlic over a medium heat for 5 minutes until softened. Add the rice and stir to coat in the butter. Pour in the white wine and simmer until almost completely evaporated. Gradually add the hot stock, a ladleful at a time, stirring constantly and allowing each ladleful to be absorbed before adding the next. This will take about 15-20 minutes. Meanwhile, melt the remaining butter in a frying pan and fry the chestnut mushrooms for 2-3 minutes until softened. Add to the risotto along with the soaked porcini mushrooms, Parmesan cheese and thyme. Stir to combine and season with salt and pepper to taste. Serve immediately.

recipes.name: Pollo alla cacciatora
ingredients: 4 chicken legs, jointed into thighs and drumsticks
salt and freshly ground black pepper
recipes.cookingMethod: Season the chicken pieces with salt and pepper and dust with the flour, shaking off any excess. Heat the oil in a large frying pan and fry the chicken pieces until browned on all sides. Remove from the pan and set aside. In the same pan, fry the onion and garlic over a medium heat for 5 minutes until softened. Add the bay leaves and rosemary and fry for a further minute. Pour in the white wine and simmer until almost completely evaporated

shortBio: Giorgio Locatelli is an Italian chef and restaurateur. He is the owner of Locanda Locatelli, a Michelin-starred restaurant in London, England. Locatelli has authored several cookbooks and has appeared on several television programs, including MasterChef Australia and Saturday Kitchen.

recipes.name: Coq au vin
ingredients: 8 ounces bacon, cut into small pieces
1 bouquet garni (a bundle of herbs such as thyme, parsley, and bay leaves)
recipes.cookingMethod: In a large Dutch oven or other heavy pot, fry the bacon over medium heat until crisp. Remove the bacon with a slotted spoon and set aside. Season the chicken pieces with salt and pepper and brown them in the bacon fat over high heat, in batches if necessary. Remove the chicken from the pot and set aside. Add the onion, carrots, and celery to the pot and cook over medium heat until the vegetables are softened. Add the garlic and cook for another minute. Sprinkle the flour over the vegetables and stir to combine. Add the wine, chicken stock, and tomato paste and stir to combine. Return the bacon and chicken to the pot and add the bouquet garni. Bring the mixture to a simmer, then cover and cook over low heat for 1-2 hours, or until the chicken is tender and the sauce is thickened. Remove the bouquet garni and serve hot.

recipes.name: Pappardelle al Cinghiale
ingredients: Salt and freshly ground black pepper
recipes.cookingMethod: In a large saucepan, heat the olive oil over a medium heat. Add the garlic, celery, carrots, and onion and cook until softened, about 10 minutes. Add the wild boar meat and brown on all sides. Add the juniper berries, black peppercorns, fennel seeds, bay leaves, and rosemary and cook for another 2 minutes. Add the tomato puree and canned tomatoes and cook for a further 5 minutes. Add the red wine and bring to a simmer. Cook until the wine has reduced by half, then add the chicken or beef stock. Bring to a boil and then reduce the heat to a gentle simmer. Cook for 2-3 hours until the meat is tender and the sauce has thickened. Cook the pappardelle in a large pot of salted boiling water until al dente. Drain the pasta and toss with the sauce. Serve immediately with grated Parmesan cheese.

recipes.name: Tortellini in Brodo
ingredients: 500g fresh tortellini, preferably with a meat filling
Salt and freshly ground black pepper
recipes.cookingMethod: In a large pot, heat the olive oil over a medium heat. Add the carrot, celery, onion, and garlic and cook until softened, about 10 minutes. Add the bay leaves, rosemary, and thyme and cook for another 2 minutes. Add the broth and bring to a boil. Reduce the heat to a gentle simmer and cook for 30 minutes. Cook the tortellini in a large pot of salted boiling water until al dente. Drain the pasta and divide among bowls.

shortBio: Carlo Cracco is an Italian chef and television personality. He is the owner of Cracco Restaurant, a Michelin-starred restaurant in Milan, Italy. Cracco has appeared on several television programs

recipes.name: Linguine alle vongole
recipes.cookingMethod: Cook the linguine pasta in salted boiling water. Meanwhile, sauté the garlic in olive oil, add the cherry tomatoes and the clams. Cover and cook until the clams open. Toss the linguine with the clam sauce and garnish with parsley.

recipes.name: Risotto alla Milanese
recipes.cookingMethod: Toast the rice with onions in butter. Add the beef broth a little at a time and stir until the rice is cooked. Add the saffron and parmesan cheese and stir.

recipes.name: Ossobuco alla Milanese
recipes.cookingMethod: Sear the veal shanks in a hot pan. Remove and sauté the onions, carrots, and celery. Add the tomato paste and deglaze the pan with white wine. Return the veal shanks to the pan and add beef broth. Simmer until the meat is tender. Serve with gremolata (lemon zest, garlic, parsley).
